value: is the county seat and largest city of Taoyuan County.
is a town of high tourism interest, including the mausoleum of former ruler Chiang Kai-shek, flower farms and an old street.
is the second largest city in Taoyuan County.
is a town in southern Taoyuan County. It is where the most famous Reservoir in Taiwan, Shihmen Reservoir locates.

Often cataloged as an industrial region, Taoyuan County has more foreign laborers working there than any other region of Taiwan. Though it is the second most populated County in
, it is usually not a major target of travelers except for those with an overnight stopover at Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport.
are the two largest cities in the County. Away from the crowded plains, in the mountain area, there are still natural beauty and aboriginal cultures to be seen.
Everyone arrives at Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport (台灣桃園國際機場) begins their journey in Taoyuan County. However, it is surprisingly inconvenient if you
the airport. Comparing to the comfortable and frequent expressway buses that go to
, there are only 2 local bus routes, one for

. The buses departs 1~2 times per hour. They don't have a separate luggage space so it's quite a trouble if you are traveling with large luggages. The bus trip takes about 50 minutes, travelers who are in a hurry or don't like local bus services are advised to take taxi instead.

TRA (台鐵) has a few stations in Taoyuan County. Every local train and most (but not all) express train stops at the county's two largest train stations: Taoyuan and Jhongli. Train is a convenient method to visit Taoyuan County when coming from other parts of Taiwan.

Taoyuan County also has a High Speed Rail station. The station is remote from major settlements, but has free shuttle services to
. Estimated travel time is 45 minutes to Taoyuan and 25 minutes to Jhongli.
. Some other cities can also be reached by express buses from
. Traveling by bus in Taiwan is usually much cheaper than trains, but this may not be the case if you are coming from
—they are too close to each other.

Like many other places in Taiwan, every city and town in Taoyuan County can be reached by bus. However, English bus information almost doesn't exist. If you don't understand any Chinese, hiring a cab or renting a car may be your best bet.

value: address=Taimall Shopping Center, 112 Nankan Rd, Sec 1. Luchu Hsieng, Taoyuan County

content=Restaurant featuring western cuisine, beer, wine, cocktails, and a large screen satellite TV for international sports. Foosball and pool table available. Located 10 minutes from Taoyuan International Airport in Taimall Shopping Center.

content=A small restaurant chain local to Taoyuan County providing a vast range of Yunnan cuisine (somewhat like a mixture between Thai and Chinese), very affordable and good interiors.  Most staff do not speak English, but all of the menus have pictures.
